alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:49AM CDT until April 20 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Niagara affecting Marinette, Florence, Menominee and Dickinson Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Iron and Dickinson Counties. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Menominee River near Koss affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Marinette, Menominee and Dickinson Counties. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Menominee River at White Rapids Dam affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Florence, Iron, Dickinson and Forest Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Vulcan. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, There is widespread flooding of low lying land, farm land and wooded areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
